intro: Fagonia mollis var. densiglandulosa, commonly known as the dense-glandular fagonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Its leaves are usually small, ovate, and covered in fine, glandular hairs, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. This species is adapted to dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
